catalog_info.title: Human Evolutionary Anatomy
catalog_info.notes: M., W., F., at 10, and a weekly section to be arranged.
catalog_info.prereq: Recommended: Life Sciences 2 or with permission of instructor.
catalog_info.description: How did the human body evolve, and how does it develop, grow and function? This course provides an integrative regional overview of human anatomy, with an emphasis on the musculo-skeletal system, and a comparative approach to the evolution of modern anatomy. Additional topics include: skeletal and dental development; gross anatomy of the nervous and circulatory systems; comparative limb anatomy; and comparative cranial anatomy.
